item.title: Inside the Epic Go Tournament Where Google's AI Came to Life
item.description:
Inside the Epic Go Tournament Where Google's AI Came to Life

Edward C. Monaghan Aja Huang dips his hand into a wooden bowl of polished black stones and, without looking, thumbs one between his middle and index finger. Peering through wire-rim glasses, he places the black stone on the board, in a mostly empty zone, just below and to the left of a single white stone.

item.title: Deep Learning Paints Videos in Style of Art Masters | NVIDIA Blog
item.description:
Deep Learning Paints Videos in Style of Art Masters | NVIDIA Blog

Thanks to Instagram and Snapchat, adding filters to images and videos is pretty straight forward. But what if you could repaint your smartphone videos in the style of van Gogh's "Starry Night" or Munch's "The Scream"? A team of researchers from Germany's University of Freiburg has made significant strides toward this goal using an approach to artificial intelligence called deep learning.

item.title: ICO is investigating Google DeepMind's data-sharing deal with the NHS | TheINQUIRER
item.description:
ICO is investigating Google DeepMind's data-sharing deal with the NHS | TheINQUIRER

THE INFORMATION COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE (ICO) has confirmed that it will be casting its eye over the controversial data-sharing deal between Google Deepmind and the NHS. Computer Weekly has the scoop, having received confirmation from the ICO that it has launched an investigation into the deal following at least one complaint from the general public.

item.title: Robots have been about to take all the jobs for more than 200 years - Timeline
item.description:
Robots have been about to take all the jobs for more than 200 years - Timeline

Is it really different this time? Technology has always triggered fears of mass unemployment. In 1811 it was the Luddites, who assumed they were done for. In the 1930s, it was vaunted economist John Maynard Keynes, who implicated technology as one reason for the unemployment of the Great Depression.

item.title: Can social media predict the future?
item.description:
Can social media predict the future?

Presented by Marcus du Sautoy Scientist and broadcaster In a global population of over seven billion people, more than two billion of us use social media. It's estimated that each day we send out over 300 million tweets and share 4.75 billion pieces of content on Facebook.

item.title: Deep Learning with Tony Jebara, Director of ML Research at Netflix
item.description:
Deep Learning with Tony Jebara, Director of ML Research at Netflix

Tony Jebara is a Professor of Computer Science at Columbia University and Director of Machine Learning Research at Netflix. His research intersects computer science and statistics to develop new frameworks for learning from data with applications in social networks, spatio-temporal data, vision and text.
